fields.description:
This is the same as stated here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=311920262

However for some customers it is not possible to use other browsers, so in the OnDemand environment we'd need to apply the workaround described on the page mentioned above.
fields.summary: No "Open" button in IE8 and IE9

fields.description: Push the daily backups made of AOD instances to google drive in case GApps integration is in place. Customers will at all times have their backups available, and Atlassian will not have to recover backups from tape anymore when  needing a backup from a longer period of time ago.
fields.summary: Push AOD backups to Google drive

fields.description:
After the latest upgrade (12/17), several customers are reporting this misbehavior:

{quote}
Automated message: Errors were encountered while processing smart commits
Due to the following errors, the smart commits were not actioned and will need to be performed manually.
Error processing NG-229 #time 15m
FishEye was unable to log '15m' against the issue NG-229. There is no mapped project "NG" for repository "NG".
See the documentation for how to invoke JIRA Issue Transitions automatically.
{quote}

It seems that the JIRA app links are no longer available.

I have upgraded my own JIRA-DEV instance from fireball-190 to fireball-192 and confirm that it removes the app link from Fisheye.

* EDIT *
This is also caused by https://sdog.jira.com/browse/ODC-76.
Note that not all customers with FishEye are affected as there is a race condition.
fields.summary: Fireball-192 removed JIRA app link from Fisheye.

fields.description:
Please close this as was raised elsewhere.

The following error occurred when using the Imports Spaces functionality.

Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: not-null property references a null or transient value: com.atlassian.confluence.like.LikeEntity.content

Steps:
== Export the space ==
1. Go to Browse > Space Operations
2. Select XML Export
3. Select Custom Export
4. Uncheck Include Comments
5. Deselect All the pages
6. Select a group of pages
7. Select Export and download the file
== Change the space details == 
8. Edit the entities.xml and replace the old space name with the new space name
9. Edit the exportDescriptor.properties and replace the old space name with the new space name
== Import in the new space ==
1. Go to Browse > Confluence Admin
2. Select Import Spaces
3. Select the File to Import
4. Select Import (error occurs)
fields.summary: Error when trying to import a confluence space

fields.description:
JIRA not finding users when trying to assign issue. Keeps saying no matches found.  See attached files.

For exmaple, I have a user Joe Bloggs and when I create a new issue and I want to assign the issue to Joe Bloggs, I start typing in "J" in the Assignee field, and it does it's little whirly-twirly thing and tries to find the user, but comes back with no matches

So then I type in "Joe", but again it doesn't find a match. So I type in the users full name - "Joe Bloggs", but JIRA says no matches found.

So the end result is that I'm unable to assign issues to users.  

Things I've done - closed down IE.....logged in and out of JIRA....cleared my browser cache...prayed to god....etc.

In all, I have a about 6 users for my project and the assignee autocomplete functions will only find two of them - George Grubetic (i.e. me) and Simon Clearly.  

Very frustrating.
fields.summary: Assignee Autocomplete - not working as it should ...."no matches found".....BLOCKER!

fields.description: New feature idea from a customer: it would be handy to create a standalone Jira installation (its license covered within the OnDemand license) that would automatically synchronize with OnDemand, and display the data in read-only mode. That would provide the users with a backup, e.g. in case of OnDemand downtime or internet connection issues.
fields.summary: Ability to create a read-only standalone instance mirroring OnDemand

fields.description:
I noticed recently that after a successful migration using the migrator tool, some users were added by default to jira-system-administrators group. 

This is of a big concern as having this privilege could allow some installation that could be harmful to the entire platform.

Another inconvenient of this is that users may be blocked from normal processes because they are part of this group (jira-system-administrators).
fields.summary: After an automated migration from EHSP to AOD, jira-system-administrators group was created and some users were added by default

fields.description:
The customer in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-51909
experiences an error when trying to set the priority of an issue through a workflow transition. The error says "Unable to find field 'custom_field 10384'" In this case it results in the customer not being able to continue his issues through the workflow.

I can not find any reference to this custom field in the database.
Based on the stacktrace (see below) I suspect this workflow has been imported from another instance (not confirmed yet) The workflow in question contains the following section:
{noformat}<function type="class">
                  <arg name="field.value">UEC_SI</arg>
                  <arg name="class.name">com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.function.UpdateIssueCustomFieldPostFunction</arg>
                  <arg name="field.name">customfield_10384</arg>
                </function>{noformat}

When checking the conditions/validators/post-functions, I do not think that the post function responsible for this error is present in the post-function list as shown under the work flow, nor does anything show up indicating a possible problem in the current workflow xml. If the latter had shown up, this could have been a problem that could have been resolved by the customer.

fields.description: If a BitBucket account is linked to OnDemand then when a project is created in OnDemand an associated BitBucket repository should be created as well.
fields.summary: When a project is created in OnDemand create a linked repository in BitBucket

fields.description: Fireball-189
fields.summary: As an admin of OnDemand instance, I would like to change Google domain or remove Google Apps integration without support intervention

fields.description:
So the release Sunday night broke some macros in our ondemand instance.  they got fixed in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6246 

as of today it has somewhat come back.  I cannot add a new stats macro instance but unlike Monday at least the current pages still work.  So I need to be able to create new pages with this macro type.  It is possible that I did not test this on Monday and only verified that the previous pages with macros started working again.  

This remains a critical issue for me.

Thanks
Kyle

(NOTE: I guess I'm not able to reopen the previous issue.)
fields.summary: Same as AOD-6246 - ability to insert stat's macro was fixed Monday and again I cannot do it.

fields.description: All Conflence dashboards using the Statistics gadgets are not rendering the charts.
fields.summary: Confluence OnDemand not rendering statistic gadgets with upgrade

fields.description:
Currently if you try to log into an OnDemand instance and the username doesn't exist, you get a very unhelpful "Your account is not yet available in this OnDemand instance" message. Support has been seeing quite a few cases of this, and in nearly all cases it's been that the user has been trying to log in with their email address when that's not their username.

It would be good to have a more useful message there, so that the user doesn't have to contact support.
fields.summary: Make "account doesn't exist" message more obvious that the account doesn't exist

fields.description:
So I use the macro that allows me to get a summary of a Jira Report based on a field (reported by, component, etc..).  Now with the release on 12/3/2012 this macro is missing and I get errors ALL OVER my wiki site (I use this in dozens of places for metrics).  
I now get: 

Open 5.3 issues Grouped By Assignee:

Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https://mybirst.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:stats-gadget/gadgets/stats-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.
Open 5.3 issues that have a Customer Impacted set (Implies is probably higher priority)

Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https://mybirst.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:stats-gadget/gadgets/stats-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.
By Customer Impact (The Goal is to get this data into system)

Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https://mybirst.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:stats-gadget/gadgets/stats-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.
By Reporter (Chart):

fields.description:
In Bamboo OnDemand, clicking a project's avatar to bring up the project switcher will result in a perpetual spinner that will not load the project shortcuts to the other applications.

This also manifests as a JavaScript error on almost every Bamboo page.
fields.summary: Project shortcut is not working in Bamboo for remote applications

fields.description: When importing data in to OnDemand using the Jira Issues Importer, users from an active internal Jira Directory will fail to be imported if the import contains a disabled crowd directory.
fields.summary: Importing Data With a Disabled Crowd Directory causes users not to be imported from active Internal Directory.

fields.description:
It is a common mistake that users log in with their e-mail address instead of their username.  

If the e-mail address is attached to a valid account, then a suggestion to remove the @domainname.com part of the e-mail could be useful.  This would be instead of "Your account is not yet available in this OnDemand instance" which ends up confusing the user.
fields.summary: When users accidentally log in with their e-mail, suggest removing the @domainname.com

fields.description:
As described in [our Restricted Functions Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand] mail archiving is not supported in OnDemand, but this functions is still accessible to customers with Confluence Only instances.

The mail import crashes when this is attempted.
fields.summary: Customers can use Mail Archiving but this is a restricted function.

fields.description:
According to our documentation on [Creating a Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Board#CreatingaBoard-CreatingaCompletelyNewBoard]:

{quote}
If you are on the GreenHopper Getting Started page, simply click either Create a new board or Create a new project and board, then select (or create) a project, type the name of your new board — and you're done! 
{quote}

However, it doesn't work for user with admin rights. Steps to reproduce:

* Login in JIRA with a user with sysadmin permission
* Click (_Agile > Getting Started_)
* The link to create a project is displayed

!rapidStart_sysadmin.png!

Now, as a user with admin rights only:

* Login in JIRA with a user with admin permission
* Click (_Agile > Getting Started_)
* The link to create a project is not displayed
* If you go to JIRA Admin session, it is possible to create the project.

!rapidStart_admin.png!
fields.summary: Getting Started page doesn't allow an admin user to create a project

fields.description: Please add the "Confluence Tabular Metadata Plugin" to the OnDemand offering.
fields.summary: Add Confluence Tabular Metadata Plugin

fields.description:
OnDemand is not checking Application Access on JIRA project creation process. As result, users without all application access are being able to create a new JIRA project without Confluence, Fisheye and Crucible application links.

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/80406/Applications.png!


!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/80409/seis.png!

 Subversion repositories are not created too.

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/80407/fisheye.png!

Looks like this bug only affects fireball-187.

Lucas Lima
Hosted PA
fields.summary: Project creation is not checking application access.

fields.description:
Dear Support,

This is an OnDemand specific question / request for advice, not a real bug or work stoppage.

We have a 25 user OnDemand JIRA instance which is working fine for months now.

There is an idea to add some pages of text to the description field which we want to be searchable (currently in the attachments, but as I cannot install plugins these are not searchable).

Do you see any problems with this?
- We have 11k records in JIRA, and this grows by 100+ per week
- So we'll add ~10kbtyes of text to like 10% or more records
- We'll use the quick search function (top-right corner) to search the whole DB
- We keep attaching those files
- We don't want to see any significant performance degradation or errors
- OnDemand cannot be "tuned" by us, so I ask this question this way

I've tried to search about this topic but found nothing. We don't use hundreds of custom fields (just a few). Also this JIRA instance won't hit the 200k records limit I've seen in some old documents.
fields.summary: Question: impact of adding desciptions for 1k recrods of 10k records (and this will grow)

fields.summary: test

fields.description: For customers that have users in both the AU and UK timezones (for example) both maintenance windows would lead to an outage during the middle of of a business day for one group of users. As such we would like to request that the entirety of the upgrade be performed over the weekend, so as to prevent outages in peak periods.
fields.summary: Perform all OnDemand maintenance over the weekend

fields.summary: Custom mail handlers are not carried over on EHSP to OnDemand migrations

fields.description:
In fireball 185, Confluence can't handle links with + sign and decode it to spaces. In previouse OnDemand fireball Confluence was generating links like:

- https://<instancename.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/11567106/file+name+space.docx

And it worked fine. Now Confluence generates the attachments links as:

- https://<instancename.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/11567106/file%20name%20space.docx

And using the older links with + sign instead of %20 won't work anymore and will give error as "page not found". This now results on all older links to not work instantly, and need to replace every + sign with 20% sign to make it work.

This works fine in Confluence standalone, both type of links works fine.
fields.summary: Confluence OnDemand can't handle URL encoding with + sign for attachments.

fields.description: We are looking for a way to easily handle issues for recurring tasks, lets say a monthly newsletter. Creating a newsletter is more or less the same process every month. It has a parent issue and several sub-tasks. It would be super awesome to define an "Issue Template" (meaning a collection of predefined issues with predefined desciptions/summaries/etc) that we could select every month and that auto-creates the parent with it's defined sub-tasks. So basicall all we would have to do is change a few dates to have everything in place for next months newsletter.
fields.summary: "Issue Templates" for recurring tasks

fields.summary: Log Time keyboard shortcut

fields.description: If no gadgets are visible on the OnDemand dashboard then the user should be automatically redirected to the login page if they are not logged. This is because the dashboard provides no value for the user when logged out and the assumed next step is for the user to log in.
fields.summary: Redirect dashboard to login page

fields.description: Customers should be able to go to the Project Summary page from a JIRA Project and have a direct link to the associated Confluence space. With the release of the new header, the only way to access the related Confluence space would be through *Administer Project > Settings > Confluence Space*, which is extremely demanding for the customers.
fields.summary: Easier Way to Access a Confluence Space From the Related JIRA Project

fields.summary: Adding external user to Google Apps-enabled domain results in stack trace: "Unable to reach remote OAuth signer"

fields.description:
After the last maintenance a couple of customers have found that their people directory is empty. This causes @mention and the Share Pages button to stop working.

This can be resolved by rebuilding the index. Simply to go to *<yourdomain>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/search-indexes.action* and click on rebuild index. This will take a few minutes, after which the people directory will be correctly populated.
fields.summary: After latest maintenance, Confluence People directory is empty

fields.description: As an administrator, I believe it would be valuable to allow admins to set the default application that a user sees upon logging in, as it is initially set to whichever application is created first in an instance and not adjustable. An admin might want users to focus on Confluence and not use JIRA unless needed, but in the current state, the user might be forced to see JIRA and have to manually switch over to Confluence after logging in.
fields.summary: Change default application after login

fields.description:
I click on the comment input area, the header disappears, instead a second, redundant "Powered by Atlassian" footer bar is displayed.

This also happens when opening a Conf page with a comment anchor (hash in URL).
fields.summary: When the comment area has focus the whole header bar vanishes

fields.description:
It appears that the *online help* link directs to a [deleted documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/JIRA+Studio+User's+Guide?clicked=jirastudiohelp] page, where it should direct to an OnDemand documentation page:

!online-help.png!
!online-help2.png!
fields.summary: Online Help Link in OnDemand directs to wrong documentation page

fields.description:
'Online Help' link is pointing to a deleted page on CAC.

Steps to reproduce;
# Open a JIRA OnDemand instance
# Click on the 'Help' icon on the top right corner of the page (on the header)
# Select 'Online Help' link
#* It redirects you to a deleted page on CAC
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/JIRA+Studio+User%27s+Guide?clicked=jirastudiohelp

*Update 11-15-2012*

Now, on step *3*, clicking on the 'Online Help' link redirects to a page showing the following:

Hi everyone,

Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].

I am having performance issues with OnDemand.  I use Confluence, JIRA, Greenhopper (and BitBucket).  I didn't use OnDemand for several months and when I started using it again, I noticed the performance issues.  Do you throttle back the services if you notice a user hasn't been using the site? I posted about the issue here:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/96691/ondemand-performance-unbearably-slow

It seems that the speed is much better when I use Chrome (On Windows 7).  Here are the environments that are having issues:

Windows 7 - Firefox 16.0.1
Windows Vista -  IE9
iPad 5.0 - Safari 

Thank you so much for any help you can provide.

Amber

fields.description:
In order to obtain ISO certification you have established procedures that you will provide high quality of performance of you product and you won`t harm your customers. 
I use the Confluence system to store my important documents for the ISO and CE mark of my company. Moreover, every issue that is raised for improvement in the ISO documentation is implemented in JIRA and the entire discussion and approval is done in Confluence. 
I don`t understand how you can make automatic update and to delete my entire structure of work. This structure is part of my procedures for work that I wrote to obtain the ISO. 
I demand immediate return to the previous version. Moveover, every time when you decide to do an update you are obliged to inform the customers beforehand what is about to change and to leave them opportunity not to update. 
The link between the projects in JIRA and Confluence is destroyed. 
To establish that system took me six months time. We will have a recent audit for the ISO and the CE and I have to show our working document support. And with your new update this is not the case. 
I want to have the customized tabs back with the entire information that was distributed below them. Moreover, I need back the connection between the projects in JIRA and Confluence. 
With your update my company may lose its ISO certificate. I work additional days to restore the missing parts, which is doubling the work that I did when establishing the projects. 
I would like you to calculate a proper reimbursement for the caused troubles. And moreover, a quick solution how to continue the previous workflow that I have created.
fields.summary: Return customized tabs and the integration of confluence and jira

fields.description:
User would like a direct way of exporting user, groups and group memberships from their onDemand instance.  This is very helpful when migrating to a Behind The Firewall instance that is using an external user directory such as LDAP or Crowd.

As it stands currently users must do their export, load up a Behind The Firewall version of Confluence from their onDemand backup.  After that they must manually query the database to produce a csv of their users.  The csv must then be used to import users into LDAP or Crowd.  This does not account for groups or group memberships.  Users with large On Demand instances will be hamstrung by having to recreate all of these associations manually.

Perhaps the best way of doing this would be to offer two kinds of exports.  One that is a full export that would create all of the existing users in the local Confluence directory.  A second export that would create a user directory(in LDIF or another form usable by Crowd) that could be used to create this external directory.  If Confluence could detect this kind of export perhaps it could prompt you to make a connection to this external user directory as part of the setup process. Running a validation on the expected versus existing user base would also likely be a good idea.
fields.summary: Add User and Group Membership Export

fields.description:
The Javascript date picker used on the JIRA project version administration screen sets the field with a date string that is invalid for JIRA.

The picker sets the field as day/numericMonth/year while JIRA expects day/3CharMonth/year.
fields.summary: Date Picker for Project Version Administration Returns Wrong Format

fields.description:
Provide the user the option to login in to any product that they have access to if they are using a SSO. Once they login to a project, provide them the ability to set their default page to render.

Dashboards are only in the context of the product. However, if you have Confluence, you can create your own dashboard, that provides a portal into all the other apps or any other enterprise app that users may have.

This would provide significant value to users to minimize some of the frustration of where to go for what as admins would be willing to invest the time in creating a default starting page (if a user didn't define one) to help them determine where to go for what.

If they didn't have SSO, same is true in that they could set a default starting page at least within their product (e.g. they may always want to start in a specific project, space, or board).
fields.summary: Ability For a User to Set a Default Starting Page

fields.description:

Going into Bamboo configuration as Sysadmin shows the error that no license could be read.

Current Workaround: File a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] and a support engineer can manually add the license to the instance, this will allow Bamboo to run immediately.

Here is the project config, project key is BAS and the custom confluence key is BREEZE.
!project-conf.png|thumbnail!

When browsing from the project to the configured wiki (pressing the project avatar to display the project links) you see when hovering over the link that it still points to the original space key:

When pressed you will be taken to the wrong space/page:

fields.description:
Currently, the [Linking a Bitbucket or GitHub repository with JIRA OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Linking+a+Bitbucket+or+GitHub+repository+with+JIRA+OnDemand] document directs the user to the DVCS section with the out-dated menu:

For multi-app Atlassian OnDemand sites, go to your_username > Administration > Issues tab. In the menu on the left side, click Source Control > DVCS Accounts.

Can we please also add directions on how to include a link to Bitbucket in the app chooser? From [New Header FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/New+Header+FAQ] How can we create custom links in the header?  This is relevant for folks that already had a Bitbucket account.

Thanks!

However, from the project wiki I can only go to "All open issues" and "My open issues", and not to the project homepage in jira.
It would be great if you add a link from confluence to the project homepage in jira (e.g. https://<myinstance>.atlassian.net/browse/[code]), or add a way for us to add it ourselves.

To get the same result we now either have to open two tabs, or:
* Click confluence logo (top left)
* Click jira
* Find project under "Projects"

Allowing customization of the menu would provide great options for users.

fields.description: Please add TFS4JIRA in Jira Studio OnDemand. I previously used the JIRA DVCS Connector for Bitbucket and GitHub plugin and really liked it. Now, on my new project, we use TFS and TFS4JIRA is the only alternative. Thanks!

fields.description:
With the release of the new header, the OnDemand-specific Confluence themes should have been migrated to the standard equivalents, but weren't.

The OnDemand Documentation Theme has regressed in functionality and appearance as a result. In particular, the sidebar toggle button doesn't appear, and the drag-and-drop resize doesn't work, which makes it difficult for users of this theme to hide and show the sidebar.

In the meantime you can fix it manually by switching your spaces to the plan Documentation Theme. You can change the theme by going to "Space Admin" in the Browse menu, choosing "Themes" in the "Look & Feel" section, then selecting "Documentation Theme".

You'll see a warning, "The theme you have selected does not include the Atlassian OnDemand navigation bar" but this warning is also a mistake that no longer applies with the new UI and will be removed. You can safely ignore it.

Once you've switched to the Documentation Theme, you will see the toggle button in the header and be able to drag the sidebar's right edge to resize it, just as before.
fields.summary: Atlassian OnDemand Documentation Theme in Confluence does not have a button to toggle the sidebar

fields.description: We had custom colours applied to our Confluence OnDemand spaces. With the new upgrade, we have lost our custom colours, and they are not applied to any existing spaces. When I change the global custom colours, they are applied only to the dashboard or new spaces - not the existing ones.

{panel:title=Status Update - August 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
Support for cross-product search is available:

1. *Searching for Confluence articles in Jira Service Desk* - this is available today both through the customer portal and through the agent view (Jira issue view). Check out the [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/set-up-a-knowledge-base-so-customers-can-serve-themselves/] to find out more.

2. *Searching for content across Jira and Confluence* - you can search for recently accessed content across Jira and Confluence through [https://start.atlassian.com/] 

We have plans to improve both the experience and relevancy of in-product and cross-product search in Atlassian Cloud in the future. Given that the basic functionality to search across products exists today, we are marking this issue as resolved.

Cheers,

Shihab
 Atlassian Product Management

fields.description:
This would be a major time saver for me and quite simple for you guys to implement. I look after a new Jira /confluence implementation for a team looking after 30 + event websites. Each website is a project and each project has a version for the year and a corresponding space where all documentation and processes are stored. In order to get this set up and a working methodology I've created a template project. There we store common tasks (some of which have 20 or so sub tasks)and a confluence structure with blank templates for space structure, page layouts and document buckets.

Currently I can only copy these accross one at a time. I would like to be able to duplicate an entire space or if I copy a page have the option to copy all the children below as you can with a Jira task and its sub tasks
fields.summary: I want the ability to be able to copy entire spaces or at a minimum all the pages below a certain page

fields.description:
We use bulk edit often to assign to client versions, change status, make assignments, etc.  However, once you get past the initial step of choosing to bulk edit, you lose context of where you started from.  If the user was in the context of a saved filter, it would be helpful if the bulk edit steps showed the name of the filter in the title area. 

For example, we have queries for each customer - thus, numerous queries.  We use the bulk edit for customer assignments. Sometimes, you forget what query you just went into to update; however, having the query name would provide us a clue as to the context of the few pages of issues we are working with.
fields.summary: When using bulk edit, it would be helpful to see the name of the filter you are working with, if there is one
